action.action-desc: Mr. Meeks (for himself, Mr. King of New York, Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York, and Mr. Luetkemeyer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to clarify the treatment of certain debt and equity instruments of smaller institutions for purposes of capital requirements, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Community Bank Capital Clarification Act.

section.header: Clarification for instruments of other depository institution holding companies
section.text: Section 171(b)(4)(C) of the Financial Stability Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5371(b)(4)(C)) is amended by adding at the end the following: A depository institution holding company with total consolidated assets of less than $15,000,000,000 at the end of a quarterly financial reporting period after December 31, 2009, shall be treated as if the company had total consolidated assets of less than $15,000,000,000 as of December 31, 2009, for so long as such company has total consolidated assets of less than $15,000,000,000..
